intro: Lepidaploa argyropappa, commonly known as the silver pappus lepidaploa, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Southeast Asia. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which is characterized by its composite flower heads and often showy inflorescences. The plant is distinguished by its silvery-white hairs covering the stems and leaves, giving it a distinctive appearance. Its flowers are typically small and clustered, with both ray and disk florets. While not widely cultivated, it is of interest to botanists due to its unique morphology and ecological adaptations.
